intro: Rondeletia obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, broad-ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
